meanings.definition: Lacking flavor or zest; not tasty
meanings.sent1: The soup tasted insipider than plain water.
meanings.sent2: The bland salad dressing made the salad even insipider.
meanings.sent3: The insipider sandwich was so boring, it put me to sleep.
meanings.sent4: Her jokes were as insipider than a dry cracker.
meanings.sent5: The insipider apple was like eating cardboard.

meanings.definition: Lacking in qualities that excite, stimulate, or interest; dull
meanings.sent1: The movie was insipider than watching paint dry.
meanings.sent2: His insipider speech made everyone yawn.
meanings.sent3: The insipider lecture felt like a lullaby.
meanings.sent4: The insipider day dragged on like a tired snail.
meanings.sent5: The insipider book was like reading a blank page.
